column4: on the composite ubuntu support page refers to this repository; how do i obtain it? 'deb http://javadesktop.org/lg3d/debian stable contrib'
you can add repositories by using System > Administration > Software Sources or by adding them manually to /etc/apt/sources.list
deb http://javadesktop.org/lg3d/debian stable contrib  <----so does this look like the correct line to add to software sources, ezackly as you see it here?
it looks correct, but you should make certain it won't cause problems with Ubuntu before you use it.
